ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: pre-treatment assessment or post-assessment
drank alcohol at least six times in the past 12 months
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: 12 month period when drank the most (MM/YYYY)
Notes: two-digit integer month/four-digit integer year

ElementDescription: alcohol is often taken in larger amounts OR over a longer period than was intended
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: there is persistent desire or unsuccessful efforts to cut down or control alcohol use
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: a great deal of time is spent in activities necessary to obtain alcohol, use alcohol, or recover from its effects
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: craving, or a strong desire or urge to use alcohol
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; 5= True but ONLY around other users -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: recurrent alcohol use resulting in a failure to fulfill major role obligations at work, school or home
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: continued alcohol use despite have persistent or recurrent social or interpersonal problems caused or exacerbated by the effects of alcohol
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: important social, occupational or recreational activities given up or reduced because of alcohol use
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: recurrent alcohol use in situations in which it is physically hazardous
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: alcohol use is continued despite knowledge of having a persistent or recurrent physical or psychological problem that is likely to have been caused or exacerbated by alcohol
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: alcohol use, tolerance
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: alcohol use, withdrawal
Notes: 1= Absent or false or No; 2 = Subthreshold; 3 = Threshold or true or Yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = Missing or not reported

ElementDescription: at least two alcohol use disorder items coded "3" during the past 12 months
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: alcohol use, severity
Notes: 1= mild; 2 = moderate; 3 = severe; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: at least one alcohol use disorder symptom (except for craving) in the past 3 months
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: number of months prior to interview when the subject last had any alcohol use disorder symptom (except for craving)
alcohol use, in controlled environment
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: alcohol use, remission
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: Was there ever a time in your life when you often had such a strong desire to drink that you couldnt resist taking a drink or found it difficult to think of anything else?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? had such a strong desire to drink that you couldnt resist taking a drink or found it difficult to think of anything else
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Did you ever need to drink a larger amount of alcohol to get an effect, or did you ever find that you could no longer get a buzz or a high on the amount you used to drink?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? need to drink a larger amount of alcohol to get an effect, or did you ever find that you could no longer get a buzz or a high on the amount you used to drink
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Did you ever have times when you stopped, cut down, or went without drinking and then experienced symptoms like fatigue diarrhea, the shakes, or emotional problems?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months?  when you stopped, cut down, or went without drinking and then experienced symptoms like fatigue diarrhea, the shakes, or emotional problems
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Did you ever have times when you started drinking even though you promised yourself you wouldnt, or when you drank a lot more than you intended?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? drinking even though you promised yourself you wouldnt, or when you drank a lot more than you intended
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Were there ever times when you drank more frequently or for more days in a row than you intended?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? drank more frequently or for more days in a row than you intended
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Did you ever have times when you started drinking and became drunk when you didnt want to?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? started drinking and became drunk when you didnt want to
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Were there ever times when you tried to stop or cut down on your drinking and found that you were not able to do so?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? tried to stop or cut down on your drinking and found that you were not able to do so
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Did you ever have periods of several days or more when you spent so much time drinking or recovering from the effects of alcohol that you had little time for anything else?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? spent so much time drinking or recovering from the effects of alcohol that you had little time for anything else
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Did you ever have a period of a month or longer when you gave up or greatly reduced important activities because of your drinking  like sports, work, or seeing friends and family?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? gave up or greatly reduced important activities because of your drinking  like sports, work, or seeing friends and family
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Did you ever continue to drink when you knew you had a serious physical or emotional problem that might have been caused by or made worse by drinking?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? had a serious physical or emotional problem that might have been caused by or made worse by drinking
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Was there ever a time in your life when your drinking or being hung over frequently interfered with your work or responsibilities at school, on a job, or at home?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2 = Prefer not to answer; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Above, you reported some problems associated with your alcohol use. To be clear, did these problems occur within the same 12month period?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? drinking or being hung over frequently interfered with your work or responsibilities at school, on a job, or at home
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Was there ever a time in your life when your drinking caused arguments or other serious or repeated problems with your family, friends, neighbors, or coworkers?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2 = Prefer not to answer; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: was this in the last 12 months? drinking caused arguments or other serious or repeated problems with your family, friends, neighbors, or coworkers
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: did you continue to drink even though it caused problems with these people?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2 = Prefer not to answer; 888= No Response; 999= Logical Skip

ElementDescription: Were there ever times in your life when you were often under the influence of alcohol in situations where you could get hurt, for example when riding a bicycle, driving, operating a machine, or anything else?

ElementDescription: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project (used for source IDs that change depending on timepoint/visit/etc.)

People who drink regularly for a while may feel bad when they drink less or stop drinking.  These feelings are more intense and can last longer than a hangover.  Have you ever had symptoms like fatigue, headaches, diarrhea, tremors, or emotional problems when you drank less, stopped drinking or were not drinking?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Did you ever drink an alcoholic beverage to avoid problems like these?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever started drinking even though you had promised you wouldn't or drink more than you intended?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever drank more frequently or for more days in a row than you intended?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever tried to drink less or stop drinking and could not do it?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever had periods of several days or more when you spent so much time drinking or recovering from the effects of alcohol that you had little time for anything else?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever had a period when you stopped doing important activities (such as sports, work, or seeing friends and family) or greatly reduced those activities because of drinking?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Has your drinking ever caused repeated arguments or other serious problems with family, friends, neighbors, or coworkers?
Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

Notes: -1 = No; 0 = Prefer not to answer; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: What psychiatric conditions (if any) does this individual have based on a clinical perspective?
Notes: 0 = No indication of psychiatric disorder; 1 = Depression; 2 = Mania; 3 = Generalized Anxiety Disorder; 4 = Other Anxiety Disorder (e.g. Panic, Agoraphobia, Social Anxiety Disorder); 5 = Alcohol Use Disorder; 6 = Other Substance Use Disorder (e.g. Marijuana, Benzodiazepines, Opioid); 7 = Psychosis; 8 = Somatic Symptom Disorder; 9 = Mental illness due to a medical condition (e.g. Anemia, Hypothyroid); 10 = Posttraumatic Stress Disorder; 11 = Dementia; 555 = Other Psychiatric Disorder
